slide_0.title: Now you will have to pass a Test
slide_0.content: You must answer 17 from 20 questions in order to get the certificate. Please click next slide to start

slide_1.title: According to the hierarchy of control measures, what should you try to do first in order to reduce the risks from abrasive wheels?
slide_1.answer: a. Remove the need for using an abrasive wheel
bullets: a. Remove the need for using an abrasive wheel
b. Consult workers and ask for their opinions
c. Issue PPE to workers

slide_2.title: How often should you carry out a visual inspection of an abrasive wheel?
bullets: a. At the end of the day
b. Every month
c. Before each use

slide_3.title: What is the primary purpose of abrasive wheels training?
slide_3.answer: b. To ensure safe and proper use of abrasive wheels
bullets: a. To learn about different wheel colours
b. To ensure safe and proper use of abrasive wheels
c. To improve workplace aesthetics

slide_4.title: Which of the following is a key hazard associated with abrasive wheels?
slide_4.answer: c. Wheel breakage and flying debris
bullets: a. Excessive noise
b. Bright lighting
c. Wheel breakage and flying debris

slide_5.title: What is the purpose of the Safety, Health and Welfare at Work Act 2005 in Ireland?
slide_5.answer: c. Ensuring the safety and health of employees
bullets: a. Regulating noise levels in the workplace
b. Promoting employee vacations
c. Ensuring the safety and health of employees

slide_6.title: What should you do if you find an abrasive wheel with visible cracks or chips?
bullets: a. Continue using it cautiously
b. Replace it immediately
c. Ignore it and continue working

slide_7.title: How does using a steel ring help minimize the risks of an abrasive wheel breaking?
slide_7.answer: c. Steel rings are designed to retain the wheel fragments if wheel breakage occurs
bullets: a. The steel ring stops the wheel from breaking
b. The steel allows the wheel to withstand high stress
c. Steel rings are designed to retain the wheel fragments if wheel breakage occurs

slide_8.title: How can you store thin, organic bonded wheels?
slide_8.answer: a. Laid flat on a horizontal surface of steel or similar rigid material
bullets: a. Laid flat on a horizontal surface of steel or similar rigid material
b. Upright, face on, held in place with partitions to prevent rolling
c. Horizontally in a warm place

slide_9.title: In which of the following situations would you be obligated to take action to reduce workplace noise?
slide_9.answer: c. When using a pedestal grinding machine operating at 95 dB
bullets: a. When using a cutting machine operating at 75 dB
b. When the weekly noise exposure is 110 dB
c. When using a pedestal grinding machine operating at 95 dB

slide_10.title: Why should some grinding machines be fitted with local exhaust ventilation?
slide_10.answer: c. To minimize exposure to dust and harmful debris, which could cause health risks to the user
bullets: a. So they can be used more frequently
b. So that the user doesn’t need to wear PPE
c. To minimize exposure to dust and harmful debris, which could cause health risks to the user

slide_11.title: Vibration from hand-held grinding machines can cause what?
bullets: a. Tinnitus
b. Broken wrists or fingers
c. Hand Arm Vibration Syndrome

slide_12.title: Which of these groups of people are most likely to be at risk of harm from abrasive wheels?
slide_12.answer: c. People who mount, dress and frequently use abrasive wheels
bullets: a. Cleaning staff
b. People who use the abrasive wheels infrequently
c. People who mount, dress and frequently use abrasive wheels

slide_13.title: Which PPE item is essential when operating abrasive wheels?
slide_13.answer: c. Safety glasses with side shields
bullets: a. Helmet
b. Steel-toed shoes
c. Safety glasses with side shields

slide_14.title: When conducting a wheel dressing operation, what is the purpose?
slide_14.answer: b. To reshape and clean the wheel for improved performance
bullets: a. To add color to the wheel
b. To reshape and clean the wheel for improved performance
c. To reduce the wheel’s size

slide_15.title: In case of a fire during abrasive wheel operation, what should you do?
slide_15.answer: b. Attempt to extinguish the fire using an appropriate fire extinguisher
bullets: a. Run away from the fire
b. Attempt to extinguish the fire using an appropriate fire extinguisher
c. Ignore the fire and continue working

slide_16.title: Who is responsible for carrying out a risk assessment in the workplace?
bullets: a. The HSA (for Ireland)/HSE (for UK)
b. Every employee
c. A competent person

slide_17.title: Which legislation applies to the use of abrasive wheels?
bullets: a. COMAH 2015
b. PUWER 1998
c. RIDDOR 2013

slide_18.title: As well as at least annually, when should you review and update your risk assessment?
slide_18.answer: c. When there are any changes in the workplace that may affect your risk assessment
bullets: a. Only when new processes have been introduced
b. Only when new staff start working
c. When there are any changes in the workplace that may affect your risk assessment

slide_19.title: What illness can directly arise from inhaling harmful dust while using abrasive wheels?
slide_19.answer: c. Development of lung conditions, such as pneumonia
bullets: a. Tinnitus
b. Musculoskeletal disorders
c. Development of lung conditions, such as pneumonia

slide_20.title: Legally, you need to write down the findings of your risk assessment when employing a minimum of how many staff?
